numbered_ace_sentences: 2. If a person has a lot of money then the person is more likely to get into that college.
3. If a person has a legacy advantage then the person is more likely to get into that college.
4. If a person does not have a lot of money then the person is less likely to get into that college.
5. If no relative of a person attended that college then the person is less likely to get into that college.
6. I wonder about the cause of this pattern.
7. Some people have a high income.
8. I wonder whether a person with a high income has a higher chance of getting into that college.
10. I wonder whether some people with a lot of money bribe these schools.
11. I wonder whether some people with a lot of money give a lot of money to these schools.
12. I wonder whether this helps their children get into a good school.
14. Some people in my community want to get into these schools.
15. Not many people in my community have a lot of money.
17. If a person does not have a lot of money then it is harder for the person to get into that college.
18. The headline is: Elite colleges and legacy advantage.
